Your Martial Arts die increases by one size and your maximum number of Ki point increases by an amount equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} modifier.

Additionally, when you spend a Ki point to use a monk class feature as a bonus action that is not Flurry of Blows, you may spend an additional ki point to make a single unarmed attack or weapon attack with a monk weapon as part of the same bonus action.
You gain an additional invocation.

When you start your turn without any Pact Magic spell slots remaining, you can choose to regain one Pact Magic spell slot. You can use this feature once and can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

feat.name: Perceptive
entries: You hone your senses until they become razor sharp. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Perception} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to checks you make with it.
Being in a lightly obscured area doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on your Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks if you can both see and hear.

feat.name: Performer
entries: You master performance so that you can command any stage. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Performance} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to checks you make with it.

While performing, you can try to distract one humanoid you can see who can see and hear you. Make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check contested by the humanoid's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If your check succeeds, you grab the humanoid's attention enough that it makes Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks with {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} until you stop performing.

feat.name: Piercer
entries: You have achieved a penetrating precision in combat, granting you the following benefits:

items: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals piercing damage, you can reroll one of the attack's damage dice, and you must use the new roll.
When you score a critical hit that deals piercing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra piercing damage the target takes.

feat.name: Poisoner
entries: You can prepare and deliver deadly poisons, granting you the following benefits:

items: When you make a damage roll that deals poison damage, it ignores {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to poison damage.
You can apply poison to a weapon or piece of ammunition as a bonus action, instead of an action.

You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with the {@item poisoner's kit|Ishiir}. If you already proficient, you double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus for any check you make with it. With one hour of work using a {@item poisoner's kit|Ishiir} and expending 50 gp worth of materials, you can create a number of doses of potent poison equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus. Once applied to a weapon or piece of ammunition, the poison retains its potency for 1 minute or until you hit with the weapon or ammunition. When a creature takes damage from the coated weapon or ammunition, that creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 2d8} poison damage and become poisoned until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Polearm Master
entries: You can keep your enemies at bay with reach weapons. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action and attack with only an {@item elvish spear|Ishiir}, {@item faunish spear|Ishiir}, {@item glaive|Ishiir}, {@item greatspear|Ishiir}, {@item halberd|Ishiir}, {@item quarterstaff|Ishiir}, {@item spear|Ishiir}, or {@item trident|Ishiir} using two hands, you can use a bonus action to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the weapon; this attack uses the same ability modifier as the primary attack. The weapon's damage die for this attack is a {@dice d4}, and the attack deals bludgeoning damage.
While you are wielding any of the above weapons, other creatures provoke an opportunity attack from you when they enter your reach.

feat.name: Powerful Build
entries: You are incredibly physically powerful.

items: You are considered one size larger for purposes of lifting and carrying weight, as well as for grappling and shoving (whether you are the one doing it or the one it's being done to), escaping from nets, or any effect that creatures gain {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} against or {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to based on being at least a certain size.

feat.name: Prodigy
entries: You have a knack for learning new things. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain one {@table skills|phb|skill proficiency} of your choice, one {@filter tool proficiency|items|type=tool;artisan's tools} of your choice, and fluency in one language of your choice.

Choose one skill in which you have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled for any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus.

After rolling for initiative but before the first turn of combat, you may draw one weapon (if necessary) and make a single weapon attack with it. If multiple creatures are present who have the ability to act before initiative begins, these actions resolve in initiative order.

When you make a weapon attack, you may stow one weapon and draw one weapon as part of the action, bonus action, or reaction, in any order necessary. E.g., you could draw your sword, strike, and then sheathe it, or stow your sword draw a bow, and attack with it. Similarly, if you have multiple attacks, you could attack with one weapon, stow it, and then draw another and attack with that.

feat.name: Quick-Fingered
entries: Your nimble fingers and agility let you perform sleight of hand. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Sleight of Hand} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to checks you make with it.
As a bonus action, you can make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check to plant something on someone else, conceal an object on a creature, lift a purse, or take something from a pocket.

feat.name: Resilient

choose.entry: Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

entries: Choose one ability score. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} using the chosen ability.
You have learned a number of spells that you can cast as rituals. These spells are written in a ritual book, which you must have in hand while casting one of them.

When you choose this feat, you acquire a ritual book holding two 1st-level spells of your choice. Choose one of the following classes: {@filter bard|spells|level=1|class=bard (Ishiir)|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=Ishiir}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=1|class=cleric (Ishiir)|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=Ishiir}, {@filter druid|spells|level=1|class=druid (Ishiir)|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=Ishiir}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=1|class=sorcerer (Ishiir)|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=Ishiir}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=1|class=warlock (Ishiir)|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=Ishiir}, or {@filter wizard|spells|level=1|class=wizard (Ishiir)|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=Ishiir}. You must choose your spells from that class's spell list, and the spells you choose must have the ritual tag. The class you choose also determines your spellcasting ability for these spells: Charisma for bard, sorcerer, or warlock; Wisdom for cleric or druid; or Intelligence for wizard.

If you come across a spell in written form, such as a magical {@item spell scroll} or a wizard's spellbook, you might be able to add it to your ritual book. The spell must be on the spell list for the class you chose, the spell's level can be no higher than half your level (rounded up), and it must have the ritual tag. The process of copying the spell into your ritual book takes 2 hours per level of the spell, and costs 50 gp per level. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it.
One-handed bludgeoning weapons have the finesse property when you wield them.

When you attack an enemy with such a weapon and you meet the criteria for using the rogue's Sneak Attack ability, you inflict an additional {@dice 1d6} damage. This stacks with the damage from Sneak Attack if you have that feature.

When you strike a surprised opponent with a weapon that qualifies for this feat, if the creature's current hit points after the attack is less than or equal to the damage the attack inflicted, they are reduced to 0 hp and rendered {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir}. This has no effect on constructs or undead.
Once per turn when you roll damage for a melee weapon attack, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice and use either total.

feat.name: Second Chance
entries: Fortune favors you when someone tries to strike you. You gain the following benefits:

items: When a creature you can see hits you with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can use your reaction to force that creature to reroll. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you roll initiative at the start of combat or until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

feat.name: Sentinel
entries: You have mastered techniques to take {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} of every drop in any enemy's guard, gaining the following benefits:

items: When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, the creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} antrule Speed|Ishiir} becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.
Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from you even if they take the {@action Disengage|Ishiir} action before leaving your reach.

When a creature within reach of a melee weapon you are wielding makes an attack against a target other than you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack with that weapon against the attacking creature.

feat.name: Shadow Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell invisibility|Ishiir} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=I;N|source=Ishiir} of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=I;N|source=Ishiir} must be from the illusion or necromancy school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Sharpshooter
entries: You have mastered ranged weapons and can make shots that others find impossible. You gain the following benefits:

items: Attacking at long range doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on your ranged weapon {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}s.
Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

Before you make an attack with a ranged weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

feat.name: Shield Master
entries: You use shields not just for protection but also for offense. You gain the following benefits while you are wielding a {@item shield|Ishiir}:

items: If you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to try to {@action shove|Ishiir} a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield.

If you aren't {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, you can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} you make against a spell or other harmful effect that targets only you.

If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.

feat.name: Silver-Tongued
entries: You develop your conversational skill to better deceive others. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Deception} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to checks you make with it.

When you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn, you can replace one attack with an attempt to deceive one creature you can see within 30 feet of you that can see and hear you. Make a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check contested by the target's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If the target creature's Intelligence is 6 or lower, this feature has no effect. If your check succeeds, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from the target and your {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}s against it have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}; both benefits last until the end of your next turn or until you use this ability on a different target. If your check fails, the target can't be deceived by you in this way for 1 hour.

You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in any combination of three {@table skills|phb} or {@filter tools|items|type=tools;artisan's tools;instrument;gaming set;vehicle (land);vehicle (water)} of your choice.

feat.name: Skulker
entries: You are expert at slinking through shadows. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can try to hide when you are lightly obscured from the creature from which you are hiding.
When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a ranged weapon attack, making the attack doesn't reveal your position.
Dim light doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on your Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks relying on sight.

feat.name: Slasher
entries: You've learned where to cut to have the greatest results, granting you the following benefits:

items: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} antrule Speed|Ishiir} of the target by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

When you score a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on all {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}s.

feat.name: Slayer
entries: You are supernaturally well suited to hunt and slay a certain type of creatures, such as the undead. This gives you the following benefits:

items: You gain one type of favored enemy, as per the ranger feature. Your weapon attacks against your favored enemies are considered magical for purposes of damage {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir}.
Once you reach character level 6, you gain the benefits of the Greater Favored Enemy class feature for the type of favored enemy chosen for this feat.

feat.name: Spell Sniper
entries: You have learned techniques to enhance your attacks with certain kinds of spells, gaining the following benefits:

items: When you cast a spell that requires you to make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, the spell's range is doubled.
Your ranged spell attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

You learn one cantrip that requires an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}. Choose the cantrip from the {@filter bard|spells|level=0|class=bard (Ishiir)|spell attack=m;r;o|source=Ishiir}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=0|class=cleric (Ishiir)|spell attack=m;r;o|source=Ishiir}, {@filter druid|spells|level=0|class=druid (Ishiir)|spell attack=m;r;o|source=Ishiir}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=0|class=sorcerer (Ishiir)|spell attack=m;r;o|source=Ishiir}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=0|class=warlock (Ishiir)|spell attack=m;r;o|source=Ishiir}, or {@filter wizard|spells|level=0|class=wizard (Ishiir)|spell attack=m;r;o|source=Ishiir} spell list. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice).

feat.name: Squat Nimbleness
entries: You are uncommonly nimble for your race. You gain the following benefits:

items: Increase your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} by 5 feet.
You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Acrobatics} or {@skill Athletics} skill (your choice).
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on any Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check you make to escape from being {@condition Grappled|Ishiir}.

feat.name: Stealthy
entries: You know how best to hide. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Stealth} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to checks you make with it.
If you are hidden, you can move up to 10 feet in the open without revealing yourself if you end the move in a position where you're not clearly visible.

feat.name: Supernatural Constitution
entries: Arcane energy runs strong in your blood, unlocking a resilience akin to that possessed by some supernatural entities. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold and poison damage.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against being {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}.

feat.name: Survivalist
entries: You master wilderness lore, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Survival} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to checks you make with it.
You learn the {@spell alarm|Ishiir} spell. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

feat.name: Sylvan Lineage
entries: Arcane energy runs strong in your blood, unlocking a resilience akin to that possessed by some supernatural entities. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Persuasion} or {@skill Intimidation} skill (your choice). If you already have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the chosen skill, your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled for any check you make with it.
As a bonus action, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied square that you can see. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against magic.

feat.name: Tandem Tactician
entries: Your presence in a scrap tends to elevate your comrades. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can use the {@action Help|Ishiir} action as a bonus action.

When you use the {@action Help|Ishiir} action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, increase the range of the {@action Help|Ishiir} action by 10 feet. Additionally, you can help two allies targeting the same creature within range when you use the {@action Help|Ishiir} action this way.

feat.name: Tavern Brawler
entries: Accustomed to rough-and-tumble fighting using whatever weapons happen to be at hand, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with improvised weapons.
Your unarmed strike uses a {@damage d4} for damage.
When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or an improvised weapon on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to grapple the target.

feat.name: Telekinetic
entries: You learn to move things with your mind, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell mage hand|Ishiir} cantrip. You can cast it without verbal or somatic components, and you can make the spectral hand {@condition Invisible|Ishiir}. If you already know this spell, its range increases by 30 feet when you cast it. Its spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

As a bonus action, you can try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. When you do so, the target must succeed on a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (DC 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat) or be moved 5 feet toward you or away from you. A creature can willingly fail this save.

feat.name: Telepathic
entries: You awaken the ability to mentally connect with others, granting you the following benefits:

items: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.

You can cast the {@spell detect thoughts|Ishiir} spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} before you can cast it this way again. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability increased by this feat. If you have spell slots of 2nd level or higher, you can cast this spell with them.

feat.name: Theologian
entries: Your extensive study of religion rewards you with the following benefits:

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Religion} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to checks you make with it.

You learn the {@spell thaumaturgy|Ishiir} and {@spell detect evil and good|Ishiir} spells. You can cast {@spell detect evil and good|Ishiir} once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a level thereafter, your hit point maximum increases by an additional 2 hit points.
Your Cunning Action choices gain the following additional benefits:

items.name: Dash
entries: You ignore {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for the current turn.

items.name: Disengage
entries: You can move through the space of hostile creatures, treating it as {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, but you can't willingly end your turn in an occupied space. The next {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against you before the start of your next turn has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.

items.name: Hide
entries: If you hide successfully, you can also spend a hit die as if you had taken a rest, regaining hit points as normal.

items: If you use your Sneak Attack feature on a creature that is suffering from one or more conditions that allow it to repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of its turn, it makes all {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against on-going conditions at the end of its next turn with {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.
When you make an unarmed strike as part of the Attack action on your turn, it inflicts an additional {@dice 1d4} damage on a hit.
Whenever you have the ability to make multiple unarmed strikes as part of the same action or bonus action, you may choose to make a single unarmed strike with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} instead.
Before you make an unarmed strike, you may choose to take a -5 penalty to the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}. If the attacks hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

When you use your Harfolk Hardiness racial feature, roll additional {@dice d12} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} and add them to the total. You gain the amount rolled as temporary HP, rather than reducing the incoming damage by it. These temporary HP last until the beginning of your next turn.

If you are hit by an attack or a spell that causes effects additionally to dealing damage, you are not subject to these effects as long as the damage does not exceed the number of temporary HP from this feature.

In addition, you may now use this feature outside of combat without a damage trigger. If you do so, you can decide to gain back HP equal to half the amount rolled rather than temporary HP, but not above your max HP.

You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with the {@item poisoner's kit|Ishiir} and you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on nature checks to extract poison from natural creatures. If you already have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in it, your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled for all checks you make with it.
Surprised creatures make {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against poison-based effects and poison damage caused by you with {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.
Poisons you use and spells cast by you that deal poison damage ignore {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to poison damage.

feat.name: War Caster
entries: You have practiced casting spells in the midst of combat, learning techniques that grant you the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} that you make to maintain your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on a spell when you take damage.
You can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a {@item shield|Ishiir} in one or both hands.

When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

feat.name: Way of the Bow
entries: You have practiced a style of archery that relies on intuition as much as perception. This allows you to attack with fluid rapidity or with great deliberation, as the situation demands.

items: When you take the {@action Disengage|Ishiir} or {@action Dash|Ishiir} action on your turn, you can make a single ranged weapon attack with a shortbow or longbow as a bonus action.

When an ally takes the {@action Help|Ishiir} action to give you {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on an attack against another creature, you can make a ranged weapon attack using a shortbow or longbow against that creature as a reaction.

As a bonus action, you may aim at a creature who has less than total cover from you. This gives you {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the next ranged weapon attack you make against that creature before the end of your turn.

feat.name: Weapon Master
entries: You have practiced extensively with a variety of weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with martial weapons and shields.
Your maximum amount of Sorcery point increases by an amount equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} modifier. You can choose one additional kind of Metamagic.
You also gain the following additional Metamagic options. Each of these can be combined with any other Metamagic option that you know and does not cost any sorcery points.

Shape Spell: When you cast a spell with an area of effect that is either a cone, line, circle, or square, you can change the area of effect to a different one from the aforementioned. The size of the area of effect changes depending on the shape as below, rounded down to increments of 5:
Shape Energy: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can change the spell's damage type to a different one of your choice.
Your critical range for attacks with your natural weapons increases by 1.
When you have to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against being {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} or {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}, you add a bonus equal to your formshift damage bonus to it.
While formshifted, you can choose to spend a hit die at the beginning of your turn (no action required), regaining hitpoints as normal.

You learn the magic of the primeval woods, which are revered and protected by your people. You learn one druid cantrip of your choice. You also learn the {@spell longstrider|Ishiir} and {@spell pass without trace|Ishiir} spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

feat.name: Mercurial Form
entries: You can use your Shapechanger racial features as a bonus action. Any time you shapechange, you may pick a number of the following benefits equal to half your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} modifier (rounded up):

items: You can exchange one physical ability score (STR, DEX, CON) for another of yours. You only exchange the base value, not including any bonuses from items, spells, or other effects.
You can exchange one skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} for another. You may take this benefit multiple times, up to the maximum granted by this feat.
You gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.
You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.
Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 10 feet.
When you jump, the distance you can cover is tripled.
Your reach increases by 5 feet.
You can breathe normally underwater.
You become acclimatized to extreme cold or heat.
Your {@sense darkvision} range increases by 60 feet.
You gain the Spider Climb monster trait.
You gain the Slippery monster trait.
You gain the Chamaeleon Skin monster trait.

entries: Additionally, choose one of the skills gained through your Changeling Instincts racial feature. Your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled for any check you make with it.

items: You learn an additional Blood Curse and you gain an additional use of Blood Maledict.
When you roll your Hemocraft Die to determine the necrotic damage you take for using a feature from this class, you can roll it a second time and take the lower result.
You gain an additional evolution feat.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, your Eidolon can use its reaction to cause you to drop to 1 hit point instead.
When your Eidolon is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use your reaction to cause it to drop to 1 hit point instead.
You can't use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
Choose either WIS, INT, or CHA. Your chosen ability score increases by 1 and your maximum for it increases by 2.
Additionally, you learn one skill that uses your chosen ability score.

feat.name: Enchanter
entries: Your studies of magic have made you particularly adept at creating scrolls and magical items.

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with the enchanter's supplies. If you are already proficient in these tools, your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled for any skill check you make with them.
If you craft a magical item that has a rarity of common or uncommon, it takes you a quarter of the normal time, and it costs you half as much of the usual gold.
You gain access to the mastery of any armor and weapon you are proficient in, as per the {@classFeature Martial Mastery|Barbarian|Ishiir|4|Ishiir} class feature.
